revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Teleadapt |model=Deskpoint Wireless |revision=v2 (TA-6950 / TA-7950 / TA-8050) |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/22/2011 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Interepoch |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=PRLTA-6950 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe=ns |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=deskpoint |default_ssid_regex=^deskpoint$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=root |default_pass=root |oui=00:09:92 |oui_eth=00:09:92 }} '''DeskPoint Wireless Version 2.0'''
The device is marketed towards usage in hotels as an in-room access point.
This FCC ID covers the TA-6950, TA-7950, and the TA-8050. *The [http://www.seshhaider.com/ProductDetails.aspx?productId=09 TA-6950 and TA-7950] ('''DeskPoint Pro''') are circular APs.. dunno what the differences between the models is. They both seem to have a built-in USB charging port. *The [http://www.seshhaider.com/ProductDetails.aspx?productId=10 TA-8050] ('''DeskPoint Pro Under Desk''') is rectangular and (obviously) meant for under desk placement.
This device would appear to be using RTL8196C and RTL8192SE/RTL8192CE.
Default settings are per the FCC manual and may be inaccurate.. :The default SSID is stated as '''deskpoint'''. There are 118 entries for this SSID currently (as of 2013-04-02) on '''WiGLE'''.
The MAC address label on the FCC EUT indicates that these devices use a 00:09:92 ('''Interepoch''') OUI.
